greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = k!*binomial(n+k-1,k) (n>=0, 0<=k<=n), rising factorial power, Pochhammer's symbol.
comment: This is the Pochhammer function which is defined P(x,n) = x*(x+1)*...*(x+n-1). By convention P(0,0) = 1. Also known as the rising factorial power. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 09 2011
reference: Ronald L. Graham, Donald E. Knuth and Oren Patashnik, Concrete Mathematics, Addison-Wesley, 1994.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions, Pochhammer's Symbol
formula: T(n,k) = GAMMA(n+k)/GAMMA(n) for n>0. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 09 2011
maple: T:=proc(n,k) if k<=n then binomial(n+k-1,k)*k! else 0 fi end: for n from 0 to 9 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
program: for n in (0..5) : [rising_factorial(n, k) for k in (0..n)] # _Peter Luschny_, Jan 09 2011
xref: Cf. A123680, A000407, A068424 (falling factorial power).
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Oct 26 2006
